name: Street Address
description: The SAD data type is used to represent street address information with separate components for street number, street name, and dwelling number. It provides structured address representation that enables better address parsing, validation, and standardization compared to simple string addresses. SAD is particularly useful for systems that need to perform address matching, geocoding, or postal validation while maintaining compatibility with various international addressing conventions.

SAD.1.name: Street or Mailing Address
SAD.1.description: The complete street address including street number, direction, street name, and street type. This is the primary address line for mail delivery and location identification.

SAD.2.name: Street Name
SAD.2.description: The name of the street without the street number or type (e.g., 'Main' from '123 Main Street'). Enables address component analysis and standardization.

SAD.3.name: Dwelling Number
SAD.3.description: Additional address identifiers such as apartment number, suite, unit, or floor designation. Used for multi-unit buildings and complex addressing.

constraints.addressValidation: Street address should follow local postal addressing conventions
constraints.completeness: Street or Mailing Address (SAD.1) is typically the most important component
constraints.standardization: Address components should support postal standardization and validation

usage: Patient and provider street addresses in demographic data
Emergency contact and next of kin address information
Shipping and billing addresses for healthcare services
commonFields: PID.11 - Patient Address street address components
NK1.4 - Next of Kin Address street information

generationHints.typical: Use realistic street addresses with proper street types and dwelling numbers
generationHints.numbers: Use realistic house numbers and dwelling identifiers for the context

implementationNotes.validation: Supports address validation and postal verification processes
implementationNotes.geocoding: Facilitates geocoding and mapping applications for location services
implementationNotes.standardization: Enables address standardization according to postal service requirements
